author: Staff Reporter
text:
Common service centre, which is being operated by women at Kamanayakkanpatti village in Kovilpatti taluk, has been selected as the best service centre.

Collector M. Ravikumar, who presided over the grama sabha meeting at Kamanayakkanpatti, presented a certificate of appreciation to the centre on Tuesday. A total of 424 common service centres had been functioning across the district and most of the centres operated by women were doing exceptionally good. He said that women were behind the progress of the family and society.

The government was extending several welfare schemes to villages, and only in Tamil Nadu gram sabha meetings were held in villages on occasions such as Republic Day, Independence Day, Gandhi Jeyanthi and May Day.

During the meeting, six identity cards were given to workers of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme and financial assistance of Rs. 3.90 lakh to 19 beneficiaries under Pudhuvaazhvu Thittam.

Project Director, District Rural Development Agency, Pitchaiya, Kovilpatti Revenue Divisional Officer M. Kannabiran, Project Officer of Mahalir Thittam K. Indu Bala, Assistant Director of Panchayats A. Lakshmanan, Adi Dravidar Welfare Officer Kamalam and others participated.

Grama sabha meetings were also held in 402 other village panchayats.
title: Kamanayakkanpatti common service centre lauded
